title: nexxypoo
author: nexxypoo
content: Hi everyone,I just took delivery of my new s19kpro and wanted to run it with braiins OS...however, contrary to the official bitmain manual and pics, the sd-card slot is not there. Instead, there is a microSD connection.Any ideas on how to overcome this? I tried using an SD card reader with micro-sd connection, but it doesnt appear to workAny and all help very much appreciated!neX

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: There is no such thing as a 'micro SD connection'... Did you mean a micro-USB connection?There *is* a micro-SD card and slot.

comments.author: Skot
comments.body: I haven’t gotten my hands on a S19K Pro yet, but I believe they come with Amlogic control boards that don’t have SD Card slots. If you want to Run Braiins or any of the other aftermarket FW, I think you need to get a new control board.

comments.author: seek3r
comments.body: Quote from: NotFuzzyWarm on October 16, 2023, 02:19:37 PMThere is no such thing as a 'micro SD connection'... Did you mean a micro-USB connection?There *is* a micro-SD card and slot. I guess he meant the microSD card slot. But its a bit confusing for me aswell. To OP:I just checked the docs of Braiins+ OS and it seems like the S19K Pro is not supported. No guarantee though, as I don't know exactly when the documentation was updated.This may be because the S19K Pro uses an Amlogic control board, as @skot also suspected.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: nexxypoo on October 13, 2023, 08:21:15 AMHi everyone,I just took delivery of my new s19kpro and wanted to run it with braiins OS...however, contrary to the official bitmain manual and pics, the sd-card slot is not there. Instead, there is a microSD connection.Any ideas on how to overcome this? I tried using an SD card reader with micro-sd connection, but it doesnt appear to workAny and all help very much appreciated!neXthat is a no gohttps://braiins.com/os/plusSupported models: S19, S19 Pro, S19j, S19j Pro, T19, S19 XP,S17, S17 Pro, S17+, S17e, T17, T17+, T17e & S9 [i, j]please note no k's on the list.

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: Quote from: seek3r on October 16, 2023, 06:06:09 PMI guess he meant the microSD card slot. But its a bit confusing for me aswell. He means Micro USB, the Amlogic C76 A113D has no Sd/Tf card slot, only a Micro USB, regardless, as Phill mentioned above, the k version is not supported by BraiinOS yet.I also have a paranoia over the letter K in any Antminer Bitmain makes, this letter brings back sad memory of the S9k, I think k stands for KABOOM!, Bitmain collects all the bad chips and stick them on all the bad control boards they have and ship them to us like hot potatoes.

comments.author: Skot
comments.body: Rumor has it you can run LuxOS on a S19k Pro with the Amlogic control board; https://x.com/LuxorTechnology/status/1712838137041277139?s=20

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: Skot on October 16, 2023, 10:35:35 PMRumor has it you can run LuxOS on a S19k Pro with the Amlogic control board; https://x.com/LuxorTechnology/status/1712838137041277139?s=20nice find. looks like to psu was external using 120volts.

comments.author: Artemis3
comments.body: I have only seen this miner with C74 (Zynq) same one used in some S19A. This control board has two fan plugs that are thicker, to acomodate higher amps. I would not advise changing this control board and keep using the same fans with some adapter, you may burn it.It is NOT supported in Braiins OS+ yet, work is currently in progress. As always, any new miner model/variation needs to be carefully studied and tested to have a reliable clean implementation.The faster others release, the more you should worry about them taking shortcuts. But its your miners at risk, YMMV...

comments.author: Gabrics
comments.body: Braiins just introduced that the newest version won't need SD card and you can install remotely!
